seen interesting talk in TV about **fake news, disinformation**.  Disinformation can be well targetted using social media to fit groups of people with exact kind of personality. For me was interesting that there is a phenomenon called [deepfake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deepfake) which is future risk for the democracy. It is about generating a video of some well known person speaking or behaving as authors want, but the real person not said or did the things. Deepfake videos are generated using artificial inteligence based software and are said to be indistinguishable from real videos within a few years. The weapon against this is to use and train/remind critical thinking and use media that are known or monitored to do good fact checking and thus releasing verified news.

Hi, manual file moving can be tricky maybe. Sometimes it can work to:
1. quit zeronet
2. move your profile from old install to new install - if you are not moving whole data folder of zeronet, but just your profile located in some zerome hub site directory, then make sure you move id to same, appropriate directory of same hub (you may try to detect which one it is using "[ZeroMe Unfuck](/1QHbf72f4vdx3QAxN1LTN9KP19J428Q85R/)" tool)

yes, a MIME type issue. it means our browser does not support streaming of the file that you are using.
-> you have to use most compatible video format across various browsers. It is .mp4 with x264 codec and aac audio codec i think: https://caniuse.com/#feat=mpeg4

Another format that hopefully will be popular (supported across browsers) is .webm:
https://caniuse.com/#feat=webm
There are much better video formats like AV1 but these [does not have hardware](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1PmPgauaH48r846Lzp3NFerYL7fPfsjisF:it:0) and software support is not yet mainstream.
